page.title: 13A DAY IN THE LIFE OF...
page.content: The day starts at 4.30, I wash and eat breakfast. 5.15-I leave for work on my Honda C90.5.25-clock-on and put my works motly on the board . This tells the manager who is available for work. As a colliery winder I have to check that the engine is in working order and any problems have been rectified with the night shift. I check all the safety devices and have a cup of tea with the banksman. The electric winder has a 500hp GEC engine able to lift 6 tonnes 68 times an hour. The onsetter in the pit bottom loads the coal. The banksman empties it, the process being fully automated. Coal winding takes place from 7.30 to the 10.40 break. The next shift takes over at 13.30. Today we have lifted 2640 tonnes,1300 tonnes of saleable coal. An uneventful day except for the slight overheating of a bearing.
